intro: Chrysoglossum, commonly known as the golden tongue plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow and sometimes pink. These plants are typically perennial and thrive in well-drained soil, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Chrysoglossum species are native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where they grow in arid or semi-arid regions. The flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological significance.
